org.ObjectLayout

Class ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ObjectLayout.AbstractCtorAndArgsProvider<T>
      • org.ObjectLayout.ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the element occupying each array slot
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CtorAndArgsProvider<T>

    public class ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider<T>
extends AbstractCtorAndArgsProvider<T>
    Supports a single (cached) constructor and set of arguments for either default construction or construction with a given fixed set of arguments (repeated for all indices)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider(java.lang.Class<T> elementClass)
      Used to apply default constructor to all elements.
      ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider(java.lang.Class<T> elementClass, java.lang.Class[] constructorArgTypes, java.lang.Object... args)
      Used to apply a fixed constructor with a given set of arguments to all elements.
      ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider(java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T> constructor, java.lang.Object... args)
      Used to apply a fixed constructor with a given set of arguments to all elements.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CtorAndArgs<T> getForContext(ConstructionContext context)
      Get a CtorAndArgs instance to be used in constructing a given element index in a StructuredArray.
      void setArgs(java.lang.Object... args)
      Set the constructor arguments to be indicated in this CtorAndArgsProvider.

      • ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider

        public ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider(java.lang.Class<T> elementClass,
                           java.lang.Class[] constructorArgTypes,
                           java.lang.Object... args)
                            throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        Used to apply a fixed constructor with a given set of arguments to all elements.
        Parameters:
        elementClass - The element class
        constructorArgTypes - The argument types for the element constructor
        args - The arguments to be passed to the constructor for all elements
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if a constructor matching constructorArgTypes
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if constructorArgTypes and args conflict

      • ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider

        public ConstantCtorAndArgsProvider(java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T> constructor,
                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Used to apply a fixed constructor with a given set of arguments to all elements.
        Parameters:

        args - The arguments to be passed to the constructor for all elements
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if a constructor matching argTypes

    • Method Detail

      • setArgs

        public final void setArgs(java.lang.Object... args)
        Set the constructor arguments to be indicated in this CtorAndArgsProvider. Enables recycling of CtorAndArgsProvider objects to avoid re-allocation. E.g. in copy construction loops.
        Parameters:
        args - constructor arguments to be indicated in this CtorAndArgsProvider

      • getForContext

        public CtorAndArgs<T> getForContext(ConstructionContext context)
                             throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        Get a CtorAndArgs instance to be used in constructing a given element index in a StructuredArray.
        Specified by:
        getForContext in interface CtorAndArgsProvider<T>
        Specified by:
        getForContext in class AbstractCtorAndArgsProvider<T>
        Parameters:
        context - The construction context (index, containing array, etc.) of the element to be constructed
        Returns:
        CtorAndArgs instance to used in element construction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if expected constructor is not found in element class
